title: Pairing Together Terms
text: We can pair together the first and second terms and the second and third terms as shown. $$f(x)=x^3-3x^2+\left(-x+3\right)$$
speech: We can pair together the first and second terms and the second and third terms as shown.  f of x is equal to x cubed minus 3 x squared, plus, parentheses, negative x plus 3,
pacedSpeech: We can pair together the first and second terms and the second and third terms as shown.   f of x is equal to x cubed minus 3 x squared, plus, , negative x plus 3,

title: Taking Out the Common Term
text: We can now take out the common terms as shown: $$f(x)=x^{2\left(x-3\right)}-x-3$$
speech: We can now take out the common terms as shown:  f of x is equal to x raised to the 2 times, parentheses x minus 3,  power minus x minus 3
pacedSpeech: We can now take out the common terms as shown:   f of x is equal to x raised to the 2 times,  x minus 3,  power minus x minus 3

title: Joining Together Both Terms
text: We can now join the whole equation into a single expression. $$f(x)=\left(x^2-1\right) \left(x-3\right)$$
speech: We can now join the whole equation into a single expression.  f of x is equal to parentheses, x squared minus 1,  times, parentheses x minus 3,
pacedSpeech: We can now join the whole equation into a single expression.   f of x is equal to , x squared minus 1,  times,  x minus 3,

title: Factoring the Quadratic
text: Since $$x^2-1=\left(x+1\right) \left(x-1\right)$$, we can simplify the function to $$f(x)=\left(x+1\right) \left(x-1\right) \left(x-3\right)$$.
speech: Since  x squared minus 1, is equal to parentheses x plus 1,  times, parentheses x minus 1,  , we can simplify the function to  f of x is equal to parentheses x plus 1,  times, parentheses x minus 1,  times, parentheses x minus 3,  .
pacedSpeech: Since   x squared minus 1, is equal to  x plus 1,  times,  x minus 1,
, we can simplify the function to   f of x is equal to  x plus 1,  times,  x minus 1,  times,  x minus 3,

title: Solving for the Intercepts
text: We must now solve for $$x$$ by setting the whole equation to $$0$$. $$0=\left(x+1\right) \left(x-1\right) \left(x-3\right)$$. This means that $$x=-1, 1$$, and $$3$$. Our intercepts are thus: $$(-1,0),(1,0),(3,0)$$

This means that  x is equal to negative 1 comma 1 , and  3 . Our intercepts are thus: , parentheses, negative 1 comma 0,  comma, parentheses 1 comma 0,  comma, parentheses 3 comma 0,
